name: Pravin Jadhav
biography: Pravin Jadhav is an Indian archer known for his achievements in the recurve discipline. He was a member of the first Indian men's recurve team to qualify for the finals at the 2019 World Archery Championships, where they won a silver medal. Jadhav made his Olympic debut at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics and is set to represent India again at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.
childhood: Jadhav was born into a family of daily wage laborers and grew up in a challenging environment. He faced significant hardships, including undernourishment. Encouraged by his school teacher, he pursued sports, initially focusing on athletics before transitioning to archery.
professional_career: Jadhav first represented India at the 2016 Asia Cup, winning a bronze medal in the men's recurve team event. He went on to compete in the 2019 World Archery Championships, helping the team secure a silver medal and a spot at the Tokyo Olympics. He joined the Indian Army under the sports quota in 2017, which provided him with financial stability to focus on his archery career.
